Simobjects

ObjectBase

class mojograsp.simobjects.object_base.ActuatedObject(id: Optional[int] = None, path: Optional[str] = None, name: Optional[str] = None)

ActuatedObject Class inherits from ObjectBase and is intended to make it easier to work with actuated objects with pybullet. Offers helper functions and keeps track of joint dictionary.

create_joint_dict()

Method creates the joint dictionary for the given object, containing both name and joint number for easier use. TODO: Add link functionality.

get_data() → dict

Method overrides the ObjectBase Parent class get_data() to instead return a dictionary containing the current pose, joint names and joint angles.

Returns

dictionary containing object base pose (list), and joint_angles/names (dict)

Return type

dict

get_joint_angles(joint_numbers: Optional[list] = None) → list

Method returns a list of joint angles that correspond to the list of given joint numbers. If joint_numbers is None then all joint angles are returned.

Parameters

joint_numbers – list of joint numbers that you would like to get the current joint angles for.

Returns

List of current joint angles.

Return type

list

get_joint_dict() → dict

Method returns the joint dictionary for the given object, containing both name and joint number for easier use.

Returns

Joint dictionary for object

Return type

dict

get_joint_names() → list

Method returns the joint dictionary for the given object, containing both name and joint number for easier use.

Returns

Joint dictionary for object

Return type

dict

get_joint_numbers() → list

Method returns a list of all the joint numbers.

Returns

List of joint numbers

Return type

list

get_joints_by_name(names: list = []) → list

Method returns a list of joint numbers that correspond to the list of given joint names.

Parameters

names – list of joint names that you would like the number of.

Returns

list of joint numbers.

Return type

list

get_joints_by_number(numbers: list = []) → list

Method returns a list of joint names that correspond to the list of given joint numbers. TODO: REDO THIS FUNCTION, IMPLEMENTED WEIRD

Parameters

names – list of joint numbers that you would like the name of.

Returns

list of joint names.

Return type

list

class mojograsp.simobjects.object_base.ObjectBase(id: Optional[int] = None, path: Optional[str] = None, name: Optional[str] = None)

ObjectBase Base Class

get_curr_pose() → list

Gets the current base position and orientation, returns a list of 2 lists: [[position],[orientation]]

Returns

list of lists [[position],[orientation]]

Return type

list[list]

get_data() → dict

Placeholder method that should be overriden if you would like to return more data. It is used in StateDefault() to collect the state information of an object. The default dictionary that is returned contains the current pose of the object.

Returns

dictionary of data about the object (can be used with the default state class)

Return type

dict

get_dimensions() → list

Returns the visual shape data dimensions of an object.

Returns

list

Return type

list

set_curr_pose(pos, orn)

Sets the current position and orientation of an object. Should not be used while stepping the simulator, only before or after a trial.

Parameters

  • pos (list) – position [x,y,z]

  • orn (list) – orientation (quaternion) [x,y,z,w]

SensorBase

class mojograsp.simobjects.sensor_base.SensorBase(unique_id, sensor_name)

SensorBase Class will eventually be the base class that all other supported sensors inherit from. The idea is to be able to attach and sensor to any object easily.

TwoFingerGripper

class mojograsp.simobjects.two_finger_gripper.TwoFingerGripper(id: Optional[int] = None, path: Optional[str] = None, name: str = 'two_finger_gripper')

TwoFingerGripper Class is a child class of ActuatedObject

create_sensor_index()

Method is a rough draft of the create sensor index method. In the future this will construct a dictionary of sensors on the object.
